derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from late Latin novatio(n-), from the verb novare 'make new'

means.word_mean: 1. (law) the replacement of one obligation by another by mutual agreement of both parties; usually the replacement of one of the original parties to a contract with the consent of the remaining party
